substeps.reasoning: This step is necessary to handle incoming calls and gather initial information.
Recording caller's information is essential for further processing and analysis.

substeps.description: Categorise call type (complaint, external referral, internal referral)

substeps.reasoning: Reviewing complaint details is necessary to understand the issue.
Assessing severity and urgency helps prioritize the complaint.
Determining the appropriate action ensures a timely and effective response.
Documenting analysis findings helps in tracking and resolving the complaint.

substeps.description: Prepare response based on complaint analysis
substeps.reasoning: Preparing a response based on the complaint analysis ensures a well-informed and appropriate response.
Contacting the complainant via their preferred method ensures effective communication.
Discussing findings and proposed resolution helps in addressing the complainant's concerns.

substeps.description: Complete form B4 with relevant information
substeps.reasoning: Completing the form with relevant information ensures accurate and complete referral details.
Identifying the appropriate external party ensures the referral is directed to the right recipient.

substeps.description: Send form B4 to external party
substeps.reasoning: Sending the form to the external party initiates the referral process.

substeps.description: Fill out form B2 with case details
substeps.reasoning: Filling out the form with case details ensures accurate and complete referral information.

substeps.description: Route form to appropriate internal department
substeps.reasoning: Routing the form to the appropriate internal department ensures the referral is directed to the right recipient.
This step directly contributes to confirming the receipt of form B4, which is a value-adding activity.
This step directly contributes to confirming the receipt of form B4, which is a value-adding activity.

substeps.description: Add incident to department meeting agenda
substeps.reasoning: This step is necessary for business operations as it ensures that the incident is discussed in the department meeting, but it does not directly contribute to creating a product or service the customer is willing to pay for.
This step directly contributes to creating a summary of the internal referral, which is a value-adding activity.
This step directly contributes to compiling all case documents, which is a value-adding activity.

substeps.description: Enter case details into archiving system
substeps.reasoning: This step directly contributes to entering case details into the archiving system, which is a value-adding activity.
This step directly contributes to storing physical documents, if any, which is a value-adding activity.
This step directly contributes to preparing the final communication, which is a value-adding activity.
This step directly contributes to contacting the complainant with the case outcome, which is a value-adding activity.
This step directly contributes to recording the communication in the system, which is a value-adding activity.
